meanings.definition: The quality or condition of being eusocial.
meanings.sent1: The eusocialities of the ants allow them to work together efficiently in their colonies.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study the eusocialities of bees to understand their complex social structures.
meanings.sent3: The eusocialities of the termites make them excellent builders in the insect world.
meanings.sent4: The eusocialities of the meerkats create a harmonious community in the savannah.
meanings.sent5: Understanding the eusocialities of naked mole rats can provide insights into social behavior.

meanings.definition: The behavior of certain animal species in which individuals cooperate in caring for young.
meanings.sent1: Eusocialities in bees involve worker bees caring for the queen and larvae.
meanings.sent2: Ants exhibit eusocialities by working together to protect and feed their young.
meanings.sent3: The eusocialities of penguins include shared parenting duties among the colony.
meanings.sent4: The eusocialities of wolves show a strong sense of family and teamwork in the pack.
meanings.sent5: Observing the eusocialities of elephants reveals their nurturing and protective behaviors towards the calves.
